div.l: For at an hole yn shone the Mone light
And by that light she sawe hem both two
But sickirly she nyst who was h h who
And as she sawe a white thynge in her ye
And whan she gan this white thynge aspye
She wende the clerke had wered a volupere
And wᵗith the staff she drowe nere and nere
And wende haue hit this Aleyn at the ful
And smote the myller on the pilled skul
And doun he goth and cryed harowe I dye
The clerkes bete hym welle and let hym lye
And greyden hem and eke her hors anone
And eke her mele and on her wey they gone
And at mylle dore yet he take his cake
Of halfe aboyshel floure wel I bake
Thus is the proude myller wel I bete
And hath lost the gryndynge of the whete
And paide for the seper euerydele
Of Aleyn and of Iohn that bete hym wele
His wyff is swyved and his doughter als
Lo suche it is a myller to be fals
And therto this proverbe is seid fulle soth
Hym dare not wene welle that eville doth
A giloure shal evir begiled be
And god that sitt in high mageste
Saue alle this compeny grete and smale
Thus haue I quytt the Miller his tale
Here endeth the Reuys tale 

And
begynneth the Cokes Prologe
THe cooke of london while the Reue spake
For ioy he thought he clawed hym on þᵉ bake
A ha quod he for cristes owne passion
This Miller hath a sharpe conclucion
